hints.content:
The Lopez family drove $\tealE{32}$ kilometers and then another $\goldE{35}$ kilometers.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7d69cff99b8ad42ea2770d4fd950601f4f7f659e)

$\tealE{32} + \goldE{35} = \maroonD{67}$

There were $\blueE{17}$ kilometers left to drive to the fair.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/01ab685c3a2ba11ed8bec0f5acb636afcef3c326)

$\maroonD{67} + \blueE{17} = \purpleD{87}$

They drove $\purpleD{84}$ kilometers.

question.content:
The Lopez family is driving to the state fair. First, they drove $32$ kilometers to stop for a snack. Then, they drove another $35$ kilometers and stop for gas. There were $17$ kilometers left to drive.

**How many kilometers does the family have to drive to get to the state fair?**    

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] kilometers
